title: Bobo et al on Black Studies - significance

content.question: Which of the following statements best describes the significance of early African history to African American Studies?

choices.label: African American Studies focuses on the more recent culture and contributions of African Americans instead of the historical origins of Afro-descendants.
African American Studies cannot include the study of early African history because most early African history was not documented and is therefore unknowable to modern scholars.
African history is essential to African American Studies only as it relates to the transatlantic slave trade in forming African American experiences and identities.
African history is a critical theme of African American Studies so that scholars can correct misconceptions about early African history.

content.answer: African history is a critical theme of African American Studies so that scholars can correct misconceptions about early African history.
